The goal of the TB CARE I follow-on program is to strengthen the National TB control system to improve the quality of and access to tuberculosis (TB), TB/HIV and multi-drug resistant TB (MDR-TB) prevention, diagnosis and treatment. Geographic coverage will be at national and provincial levels. Activities will be implemented in 35 MDR-TB and nine high HIV prevalence provinces. Target populations are TB, MDR-TB and TB/HIV patients.
In COP14 and COP15, the program will provide technical assistance (TA) to the National TB Program (NTP) to implement the National Strategic Plan on TB Control (NSP) 2011-2015, and develop the new NSP 2016-2020. The program will strengthen human resource and technical capacity to ensure sustainable MDR-TB and TB/HIV care through TA to the NTP to develop and update guidelines, training materials, SOPs and data recording and reporting. The program will continue TB laboratory capacity building activities and support improved case detection using smear microscopy and other new diagnostic tests. The program will support the introduction of new TB drugs and regimens, and new TB control approaches.
The program will not deliver direct services, but will provide TA to ensure quality of TB control activities. It will coordinate with the NTP, the Ministry of Health (MOH), WHO, and other partners, including those supported by other donors, to ensure the investment is complementary.
Activities will have monitoring and evaluation, and quality and cost efficiency improvement components. The contribution to NTP and PEPFAR targets will be measured through PEPFAR and key core indicators at the national level, including number of cases notified, case detection rate, treatment success rate, number of MDR, TB/HIV cases diagnosed and treated.
